result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
02:15 PM Attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen in court.   Defendant Jacob G Carpenter did not appear, in custody at DuPage County, IL.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court notes that DuPage County Jail will not do Zoom. 
Attorney Jensen presents statements.
The State requests a warrant be issued.
The Court will issue $1,000.00 arrest warrant.
EXT CODE 3.

ADDRESS INFO for Jacob G Carpenter
Current: 501 N County Rd, C/O DuPage County Jail, Wheaton, IL 60187 United States  (Effective: 07-14-2022)
Prior: 421 N. County Farm Road, Wheaton, IL 60187 United States

Filed by Attorney Jensen - Request to adjourn or appear by zoom
  **Reviewed by Commissioner Christopher Bailey on 07-28-2022. "It will remain on the calendar. Attorney Jensen to appear. Zoom is granted."
Dupage county does not do Zoom appearances. Waukesha Circuit court will not do any in custody, out of state jail/prisons by zoom as well.

Jensen states defendant is not able to appear in person or by zoom for today's hearing as he is in custody out of state.  Atty. Jensen needs to talk to Du Page County Sheriff.  Clerk's office to set up video appearance.  Initial appearance scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

Attorney Jensen Filed - Request for zoom
  **Reviewed by Commissioner David Herring on 07-13-2022. Granted.
